column2: (running in from her bedroom, wearing only a towel) Okay. Hey. Umm. Does\neverybody hate these shoes? '
Oh yeah, but don't worry. I don't think anybody's gonna focus on that\nas long as your wearing that towel dress. "
(to Ross) Tell him. '
(to Chandler) It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to\nstart with her! "
All right, I suppose I can wait a day. Hey, what are you doing Friday?\n'
Why? '
I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert,\ny'know he's the botanist. "
Oh God. Y'know, botanists are such geeks. "
Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie? '
Hmm? Oh, yeah. (he makes a growling sound) '
(entering, with about 20 purses hanging around her neck) Morning. Rach,\nI'm here with the purses! "
(to Phoebe) It must take you forever to find your keys. '
(running into the living room) Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs. '
Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles. '
No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today. "
Honey, just relax, it's gonna be fine. Hey, umm,. why don't I come down\nthere and I'll take you out to lunch? "
Oh honey, thank you, but Mark's taking me out. "
Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job? '
Yeah, it's kinda like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing. (to\nPhoebe) Is this actually a lunchbox? "
Umm, no, it's a purse. And there's a thermos in it. "
Oh. '
(to Ross) Hey, so can you make it on Friday? '
What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again? '
Well apparently Albert has no friends. He's very excited about the\nbachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he's getting married is so he can\nsee a stripper. "
A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so clich\xc3\xa9. Why don't you get a\nmagician?! "
Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all\nright. '

She's having lunch with him. She's having lunch with him. And you should\nof seen the hug she gave him when she got the job. And, and, and, (to Joey) he's really\ngood looking. (Joey gives an enthusiastic thumbs up) What am I gonna do? "
Don't do anything. Keep it inside. Learn how to hide your feelings!\n(pause) Don't cry outloud. "
(hanging up the phone) Yes! Guess who's in an audition for a Broadway\nmusical? "
I want to say you but, that seems like such an easy answer. '
It is me! It's a musical version of Tale of Two Cities. So I think\nI'm gonna sing New York, New York, and ah, oh I left My Heart in San Francisco.\n"
Ah Joey, I don't think you get to pick the cities. "
What? '
Mr. Dickens gets to pick 'em. "
Who? '
I'll get you the Cliff Notes. "
The what? '
The abridgment. '
Oh, okay. (to Ross) The what? '
...and the style number, and the invoice number, and the shipping date.\nGood. Any questions so far? '
Yeah. What kind of discount do we get? '
Twenty percent. '
Oh!! I love this job! (her phone rings) Wow! My first call. '
Here, let me. (answers phone) Rachel Green's line, how may I help you? "
(on phone) Hi, is Rachel there? '
And who may I say is calling? '
This is Ross? '
Ross of..... '
Of Ross and Rachel. '
Oh hi. It's, it's Mark. "
Oh hey, hey Mark. '
Hey, hold on a second. '
Okay. '
Hi honey! '
Hi! What's ah, what's Mark doing answering your phone? "
Oh, he's just goofing around. "
Ohhhhh yeah, that's, that's funny. Why ah, why isn't he goofing around in\nhis own office? "
Oh honey, this is his office too. I told you we're Joanna's two\nassistants. "
Why does Joanna need two assistants, how, how lazy is she? '
Oh! Oh my God! What did I just do? '
What? '
I think I just shipped 3,000 bras to personnel. Oh honey, I gotta go.\n(to Mark) Mark, I need you! '
Okay, bye-bye. (starts slamming the receiver down in anger.) '
Ow! Ross!! '
Oh, oh, I'm, I'm, I'm sorry sweetie, I was just trying to ah, I'm dialing\nanother number. (hangs up) "
(to Monica) All right, I just got changed in thirty seconds so you can\nbe alone with him. You'd better go for it. "
Please, I'm not going for anything. "
Well, if you don't, I will. "
Would you please go? '
Night Mon. Night Julio. '
(to Jeannine) Adios. '
Look Julio, someone left their book here. '
Ah actually, that is mine. '
Oh yeah, what are you reading? '
Flowers of Evil, by Beaudalire. Have you read it? '
Have I read it? (pause) No, are you enjoying it? '
I thought I would, but the translation's no good. "
Your a poet and don't know it. (she turns away and makes a face like 'I\ncan't believe I just said that.') "
Actually I ah, I am a poet. '
Oh, then you do know it. (pause) So um what kind of things do you write\nabout? '
Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this\nlip. (points to her lip) '
Mine? (points to her lower lip) Right here? '
I can write an epic poem about this lip. (grabs her lower lip) '
How would that go? (they kiss) Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it. "
(singing) You've got to pick a pocket or two. Boyyyyssss, (picks a\nhandkerchief from the pianist's pocket) you've got to pick a pocket or two.......... "
Lovely, just lovely. '
Really? Thanks. '
Listen Joey, we definitely want to see you for the callback on\nSaturday. '
Excellent, I'll be there. "
Okay, and listen don't forget to bring your jazz shoes for the dance\naudition. "
Ahhh! My ah, my agent said it wasn't a dancing part. "
Joey, all the roles got to dance a little. But believe me with your\ndance background it'll be a piece of cake. "
....three years of modern dance with Twila Tharp! Five years with the\nAmerican Ballet Theater?! '
Hey, everybody lies on their resume, okay. I wasn't one of the Zoom Kids\neither. "
Well, can you dance at all? '
Yeah, I can dance, y'know. (starts to dance really, really, really badly) "
Oh no, no, no, no. '
(covering her mouth in shock) What, what is that? '
Sure, it looks stupid now, there's no music playing. "

All right, I have to get that, but no-no. (answering phone) Hello?
(listens) (happily) Hi! Yeah listen, I'm, I'm in need of a stripper and I was told that
you do that. (listens) Let me ask you this, what, what do you do for the extra hundred?
(listens) So would I, would I have to provide the grapes? "
(entering) Hi! '
Oh, how was last night with Julio, senorita? '
It was soo amazing, he is so sexy, and smart, which makes him even\nsexier. Oh gosh, I gotta so you this. Last night, we were fooling around and he stops to\nwrite a poem. '
Get out! I couldn't stop if a meteor hit me. "
Okay, we have our stripper. A miss Crystal Chandelier. '
Well sure, you name a kid that, what do you expect them to grow up to be? '
Anyway um, when he left he forgot to take the poem with him. Now, I am\nlike totally dense about poetry, but I think it's pretty good all right. Check it out.\n(hands them the poem) "
(reading) The Empty Vase. Translucent beauty... '
To yourself. (finishing) Hey-hey-hey, y'know what that's pretty good. "
Oh good, I think so too. Pheebs? '
Oh yeah. '
Oh, I'm so glad you guys like it. Yay! All right I gotta go to work.\n(tries to take the poem) "
Whoa, I'm not done. "
All right, just give it back to me when your done. See you guys. '
Bye-bye. '
Oh my God, oh my God! Poor Monica! '
What, what, what?! '

What?! He was with her when he wrote this poem. Look, (reading) 'My\nvessel so empty with nothing inside. Now that I've touched you, you seem emptier still.'\nHe thinks Monica is empty, she is the empty vase! "
You really think that is what he meant? '
Oh, totally. Oh, God, oh, she seemed so happy too. '
Done. '
(reaching through the flowers) Do you have the, the Ralph Lauren file? '
Oh, yeah, sure, it's umm... (she picks up this bug and it starts to play\nthe theme from Love Story) "
Wh-what's that? "
It's from Ross, it's a love bug. "
Wow! Somebody wants people to know you have a boyfriend. '
Oh no, no-no-no, that's not, not, not, what he is doing. He's just, he's\njust really romantic. "
(to Rachel) Ah, excuse me, are you Rachel Green? '
Yes. '
(being joined by the rest of the barbershop quartet) One, two, three... '
(singing) Congratulations on your first week at your brand new job! It\nwon't be long before your the boss. "
Omm-pah, omm-pah, omm-pah. '
(singing) And you know who will be there to support... you?! Your one\nand only boyfriend... '
It's nice to have a boyfriend. "
Your loyal loving boyfriend Ross..... Ross! '
I'm hurt! I'm actually hurt, that you would think that I would send you\nany of those things out of any thing other than love. Hurt! Hurt! "
All right Ross!! I get it!! '
I mean my God... '
You're hurt! "
...can't, can't a guy send a barbershop quartet to his girlfriend's office\nanymorrrrre!! "
Oh, please, Ross it was so obvious! It was like you were marking your\nterritory. I mean you might have well have just come in and peed all around my desk! '
I would never do that! '
Look, I know what's going on here, okay, Mark explained it all to me. He\nsaid this is what you guys do. "
Yeah well if, if, if Mark said that, than Mark's an idiot. "
Mark's a genius! "
Why?! How?! How is he a genius? '
Look, don't you see what's happening here. Instead of hitting on her\nright away, he's becoming her confidant. Now he's gonna be the guy she goes too to\ncomplain about you. "
What am I going to do? '
Well, why don't you send her a musical bug, op, no you already did\nthat. All right look, you're going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few\nsurprise visits. "
I don't know you guys. "

All right fine, don't do anything, just sit here and talk to us,\nmeanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he's being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she\nstarts thinking 'Maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.' "

And before you know it, she's with him. And you'll be all, 'Ohh, man!' And
he'll be all, 'Yes!' And us, we'll be like, 'Wh-whoa, dude.' And pretty soon you'll be
like, (sadly) 'Hhiii,' and, and, and, 'I can't go, Rachel and Mark might be there.' And
we'll be like, 'Man get over it, it's been four years!!' "
He paints quite a picture doesn't he? "
(walking up to Mark) Here's the Shelly Siegal stuff from December. "
(turning around) And wait, I've got something for you. (kisses her) "
Mark!! '
It's okay, Rachel knows. "
Yeah, but even soo. '
I can't help it, I'm just, I'm just crazy about you. "
Ohhh! That is soo sweet! (gets up to get herself a cup of coffee) '

Okay, okay look, I know I'm being Mr. Inappropriate today, but it's just\nso tough, I mean see you walking around and I just wanna touch you and hold you, come on\nno one's around, just, just kiss me. "
All right that's, that's it!! Get off her! "
What is going on? '
What's going on?! (throws the love bug at him) That's what's going on!! "
(now standing behind Ross) Ross! '

I have been down in your store for twenty minutes trying to get a tie!\nWhat do I have to do to get some service?! (turns to Rachel) Hi Rach. (He's puts his hand\non her shoulder and she knocks it away.) "
Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a\ncall from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long\nIsland. "
So, does that mean the audition is off? '
Listen Joey, seeing as you've got the most experience, I want you to\ntake these dancers and show them the combination. "
What?! '

Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, (very\nquickly, Joey watches stunned) up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand\nsissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands! "
It's ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands. "
Have fun. '
Bye. (does the jazz hands) '
(entering) Hey! '
Hey. '
What are you wrapping? '
Oh-ho, look what I got Julio. '
Yeah, it's a vase. "
Yeah, just like the one in the poem. '
Well not exactly like the one in the poem. '
What do you mean? '
Remember how you said you were really dense about poetry? Oh. (hugs her)\n'
(to Julio) So! I'm just an empty vase, huh? "
What? '

Y'know, so I don't read as many important books as you do, and I don't
write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else.
And y'know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my People magazine
comes on Saturday, and the new Hold Everything catalog. Y'know but that does not
mean that I'm empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no
right to make that kind of judgment about me. "
Whoa, whoa, whoa. '
You don't even know me... "
Whoa, whoa, whoa, the poem is not about you. '
What? '
The Empty Vase is not about you. My baby, you make me so sad that you\nwould think this. '
I'm sorry, my friend Phoebe... "
No, it's about all women. Well, all American women. You feel better now? "
(sarcastically) Oh yeah. '
All right, let's do it! "
No, no, no. What was that? '
I know, it was the best I could get out of them. '
Well, people! '
People, people, people. '
Let's try it again, and this time let's watch everybody watch Joey.\n(to Joey) Show 'em how it's done. (to the pianist) Count it off. "
So ah, did you have fun at the bachelor party last night? '
Oh yeah, yeah! Look what I got, look what I got. (holds up a pen) See,\nshe's fully dressed, right? "
Right. '

And then you click it and, uh-oh, she's naked. And then, and then you
click it again and she's dressed. She's a business woman, she's walking down the street,
she's window shopping, and (clicks pen) whoa-whoa-whoa, sh-she's naked! (Rachel just
stares at him.) "
(entering) Hi. '
Hello. '
Y'know what, I'm, I'm gonna spend some alone time with the pen. "
(sits down next to her) I'm sorry, I was an idiot. "
A big idiot. '
A big idiot. Just you have to realize is, this whole Mark thing is kinda\nhard for me. '
Honey, why is it hard, I mean we've been together for almost a year now?\n"

Well, I was with Carol for like eight years and I lost her. And now if\nit's possible I think I love you even more. So, it's hard for me to believe that I'm not\ngonna, well that someone else is not going to take you away. "
Let it be me! Let it be me! '
Honey, that's very sweet, it just seems to me though, that if two people\nlove each other and trust each other, like we do, there's no reason to be jealous. (she\nkisses him) "
I gotta get going. Bye Chandler. '
Oh, okay Ross. Listen, this pen is kinda getting boring, so can you\npick me up some porn? '
Where ya going? '
Oh, I've got to go pick up Ben, we've got a play date this afternoon. "
Ohh, with who? '
Oh, just this woman that I met last night at the party. '
There was a woman at the... (realizes) The stripper?! '
Yeah. '
You have a play date with a stripper?! '
Man, I gotta get a kid. (looks at the pen and starts laughing) '
Ah, yeah, yeah. Umm, we started talking after she y'know, did her thing.\nAnd it turns out she's got a boy about Ben's age, so we're taking them to a gym-boree\nclass. Why, is that okay? "
Sure, is she married? '
Ahh, no. '
Oh. (starts shaking the sugar down in a packet really hard.) '
Are you jealous? '
Noo, I y'know I don't see why she has to play with you, that's all. I\nmean doesn't she have any y'know other stripper moms friends of her own? "
You are totally jealous. '
I'm not jealous. All right this is about, umm, people feeling certain\nthings y'know about strippers. And y'know, and um, I... "
Honey, I love you too. '
Ugh. Wait, wait, wait. '
What? '
Huh. '
(to Chandler) Well, there's a kiss that he won't forget for a couple of\nhours, y'know. "
Yeah. Either that, or you just turned him on and sent him off to a\nstripper. '
(entering) Is there a Julio here? '
(to him) I am Julio. '
(singing) Mister Pretensous, (Monica stands up in the background) you think\nthere's no one finer, well but your poems are unpublished, and you work in a diner. "
Your no God's gift to women, that's all in your headdddd. You are just\na buttmunch. "
No one likes a buttmunch. '
And your also bad in bedd-edd-edd!. '
